meanings.definition: To clean or polish with a cloth or brush.
meanings.sent1: She anticlings the table every evening.
meanings.sent2: I anticlinged the car to make it shine.
meanings.sent3: The cat anticlings itself by rubbing against the furniture.
meanings.sent4: His smile anticlings the room with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The sun anticlings the sky with vibrant colors at sunset.

meanings.definition: A cloth or brush used for cleaning or polishing.
meanings.sent1: She grabbed the anticling to wipe the dust off the shelves.
meanings.sent2: The anticling was soft and gentle on the delicate surface.
meanings.sent3: The anticling looked like a fluffy cloud in her hand.
meanings.sent4: He held the anticling like a magic wand, making everything sparkle.
meanings.sent5: The old anticling had seen many years of faithful service.

meanings.definition: The act of cleaning or polishing with a cloth or brush.
meanings.sent1: Her anticling of the windows was thorough and meticulous.
meanings.sent2: The anticling left a trail of cleanliness wherever it went.
meanings.sent3: The anticling competition at the fair was surprisingly intense.
meanings.sent4: His anticling of the silverware was like a symphony of shine.
meanings.sent5: The anticling of the floors made the whole house sparkle.
